title: Middlesbrough defender Ben Gibson drafted into England squad for Lithuania clash
text:
Chris Smalling withdraws from England squad with injury as Middlesbrough defender Ben Gibson is drafted in Gareth Southgate has turned to the defender with Gary Cahill suspended and Phil Jones out injured Share Gibson has been drafted up (Photo: Mike Hewitt) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Gareth Southgate has called Middlesbrough defender Ben Gibson into the England squad to face Lithuania after Manchester United's Chris Smalling pulled out with injury. 
The Three Lions boss saw his options as the back dwindle when Manchester United's Phil Jones pulled out with a foot injury earlier this week. 
Chelsea defender Gary Cahill is suspended for Sunday's World Cup qualifier so the Three Lions boss has gone back to his former team to hand Gibson first call-up. 
The 24-year-old has been one of the bright spots in a disappointing season for Boro, who are currently sit second from bottom. 
Gibson was watched by former England manager Sam Allardyce and Southgate has now moved to include him. Gibson has had an impressive season (Photo: Richard Heathcote) 
He joins fellow centre-backs Chris Smalling, John Stones and Michael Keane in the squad for Sunday afternoon qualifier. 
England go into Sunday's Wembley clash against Lithuania sitting at the top of Group F, two points ahead of Slovenia. 
The winners claim a place in Russia next year with second place going to a potential play-off. poll loading Who will win at Wembley? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
